intro: Sphaerolobium stenopterum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed burr legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by distinctive, spiny pods. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a preference for well-drained soils. Sphaerolobium stenopterum is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion.
